question: \text{A "pick your own" strawberry farm charges each customer a \$10 entry fee,} \\ \text{plus \$3 per pound of strawberries picked.} \\ \text{Which of the following functions describes a customer\'s total cost in dollars, } c, \\ \text{as a function of the number of pounds of strawberries picked, } p?
\text{If } 11x - 22 = 4(x - 2), \text{ what is } 2x?
\text{An Internet service charges an initial membership fee plus a fixed monthly cost (graph shown).} \\ \text{What is the fixed cost per month?}
\text{If } x - y = 6, \text{ what is } x^2 - 2xy + y^2?
\text{Which of the following is the equation of the line shown? }
\text{A delivery van travels at an average} \\ \text{speed of 30 miles per hour. If} \\ \text{it travels 8 hours per day, how} \\ \text{many miles will it travel in 6 days?}
\text{The graph of the function } y = x^2 - x - 2 \\ \text{is shown. What is the sum of} \\ \text{the roots of this function?}
\text{A rectangle has a width of 2a. If the length of the rectangle is 3.5 times its width,} \\ \text{what is the perimeter of the rectangle, in terms of a?}
\text{A puppy’s weight increases 35 percent each month. If the puppy's initial weight is 10} \\ \text{pounds, approximately how many pounds will the puppy weigh after 4 months?}
\text{In the figure, point C is the center of the circle,} \\ \text{and the measure of angle B is 37°. Which of the following expresses the length of the radius?}
\text{If } \sqrt{xy} = 3, y - z \text{ and } z = 6, \text{ what is the value of } x?
\text{If } -4x + 46 < x - 4, \text{ what is the minimum value of } x?

\text{Suppose the larva of a certain insect species has an initial mass of 10 grams} \\ \text{and grows linearly from t = 0 to t = 48 hours. If the mass of the larva} \\ \text{is 14 grams after 48 hours, what was its mass, in grams, at t = 6 hours?}
\text{\\| 3a - 6 \\| = 2x} \\ \text{What is the product of the solutions to the equation shown?}
2x^2 + 16x + 2 = 0. \text{ What is the value of x}
2x^2 - x - 15 = 0. \text{ Which is a possible value of } x?

\text{The figure shows the route that Max} \\ \text{currently takes to work and back} \\ \text{home every day. The city is} \\ \text{planning to build an expressway that} \\ \text{would cross through the city. Assuming} \\ \text{an average gas consumption of 20} \\ \text{miles per gallon, how many gallons} \\ \text{of gas will Max save each} \\ \text{day by taking the expressway to} \\ \text{and from work?}
\text{Which of the following functions correctly models} \\ \text{the data in the table?}
\text{Which of the following is equivalent to} \\ \dfrac{3x^2 + 5x - 7}{2x^3 - 1} ?
\text{The ratio of the perimeters of the two} \\ \text{triangles in the figure is 7:4. What is the} \\ \text{perimeter of the smaller triangle?}

\text{The scatterplot shows the relationship between body mass index,} \\ \text{low-density lipoprotein (LDL), and the line of best fit for the data.} \\ \text{How many of the 12 people have an actual LDL} \\ \text{that differs by 10 or more milligrams per deciliter from the LDL predicted by the line of best fit?}
\text{If } \sqrt{xy} = 3,\ y = z^2,\ \text{and } z = 6,\ \text{what is the value of } x?
